revised_title: Investigating the Structure and Absorption Spectrum of Gold-Leaf
tldr: The author examines the structure and absorption spectrum of gold-leaf using microscopy and various experiments. They discover that the unique appearance of gold-leaf, featuring black lines and varying thickness, is not due to the crystalline structure of the alloyed gold or the gold-beating process. The author concludes that the lines are likely caused by the softness of the pure gold and the process of beating.
